summary: Create a website for Loura Earth Mover.

existing_features.title: Build a responsive multi-section marketing website for “Loura Earth Mover” with clear navigation and the following pages/sections: Home (hero + value proposition), Services, About, Gallery (images), and Contact.

Implement a consistent, distinctive visual theme for the site (colors, typography, spacing, and component style) appropriate for a heavy equipment/earthmoving brand; apply it consistently across all pages/sections.
Create a Gallery section that renders a grid of static images from local assets and supports viewing images in a larger lightbox/modal.

Add a public Contact form that collects: name, email, phone (optional), service needed (dropdown), location (optional), and message; validate required fields client-side and show clear success/error states in English.
Add an admin-only “Inquiries” view in the frontend that allows authenticated admins to sign in with Internet Identity and review stored contact inquiries (list + detail view).

Add an admin-only Gallery management UI reachable via hash routing under the existing admin area (e.g., #/admin/gallery) that allows authenticated admins to upload images to the backend, view a list of uploaded gallery images, and delete uploaded images.

Update the public Gallery section to support rendering uploaded gallery images from the backend. If uploaded images exist, show them; otherwise, fall back to the current static local assets-based gallery.

Add React Query hooks for the new gallery upload/list/fetch/delete backend APIs and wire them into the admin gallery management UI and public Gallery section, including appropriate cache invalidation after upload/delete.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a website for Loura Earth Mover

Implement backend persistence for contact inquiries in the single Motoko actor, including: createInquiry (public), listInquiries (admin-only), and getInquiry (admin-only), with stored timestamp and basic field data.
Define an admin authorization mechanism on the backend based on a fixed allowlist of Principal(s) (configurable in code) and enforce it for admin-only inquiry APIs.
Add photo upload capability so admins can upload images (e.g., for the Gallery) instead of relying only on static local assets.

Add backend data structures and APIs to support admin-only uploading and managing Gallery images stored in canister state, including: (1) upload a new image file (bytes + content type + filename + optional alt text), (2) list uploaded gallery images (metadata only), (3) fetch a gallery image by id (bytes + content type), and (4) delete a gallery image by id.

Implement safe persistence for uploaded gallery images across canister upgrades while preserving existing stored state (inquiries, user profiles, and access control state). If a migration is needed due to new stable fields, add a conditional backend/migration.mo to migrate existing state forward.
